description.narrative: The Diplomacy Training program (DTP) Limited is an independent non-government organisation affiliated with the Faculty of Law at the University of New South Wales. DTP provides education in human rights advocacy and seeks to advance human and empower civil society in the Asia-Pacific region through quality training and by building skills and capacities of advocates. Funding under this initiative supports: DTP's human rights training activities for approximately 120 human rights defenders and community advocates in the Asia-Pacific region; facilitate collaboration and networking among human rights defenders; deliver thematic training programs on contemporary human rights issues; deliver training in relation to the United Nations Universal Periodic Review and ASEAN's Intergovernmental Commission of Human Rights; and build and support the 2000 strong DTP Alumni network to increase interaction between human rights advocates. The total value of this initiative is $0.1 million to be expensed
